unnormalised: So, someone asked about getting into top Indian universities for engineering. It reminded me of my own JEE Main days back in 2016. I was aiming for IIT Bombay, specifically Computer Science. Scored a decent 180/360 but the cut-off was insane that year!
normalised: So, someone asked about getting into top Indian universities for engineering. It reminded me of my own J-E-E Main days back in two thousand and sixteen. I was aiming for I-I-T Bombay, specifically Computer Science. Scored a decent one hundred and eighty divided by three hundred and sixty but the cut-off was insane that year!

unnormalised: My coaching centre, FIITJEE Delhi, had predicted my rank to be somewhere around 2000, but I ended up with a rank of 2500. Disappointed, obviously. I knew I wouldn't get my dream course at IITB with that score. Many of my friends were in the same boat - aiming high but falling just short. Some were trying for BITS Pilani too.
normalised: My coaching centre, F-I-I-T-J-E-E Delhi, had predicted my rank to be somewhere around two thousand, but I ended up with a rank of two thousand five hundred. Disappointed, obviously. I knew I wouldn't get my dream course at I-I-T-B with that score. Many of my friends were in the same boat - aiming high but falling just short. Some were trying for B-I-T-S Pilani too.

unnormalised: My uncle, Prof. Sharma from DTU, suggested looking into newer IITs or even NITs. He said that the curriculum was quite similar and placements were improving rapidly. He even mentioned some NITs were now offering average packages of Rs. 15 LPA. It made me rethink my options.
normalised: My uncle, Professor Sharma from D-T-U, suggested looking into newer I-I-T-s or even N-I-T-s. He said that the curriculum was quite similar and placements were improving rapidly. He even mentioned some N-I-T-s were now offering average packages of rupee fifteen L-P-A. It made me rethink my options.

unnormalised: Ultimately, I chose Computer Science at NIT Trichy. It wasn’t IIT Bombay, but the faculty was great, and the campus life was awesome. Looking back, I think it was the right decision. Secured a placement at Amazon with a package of ₹30 LPA, so things worked out in the end.
normalised: Ultimately, I chose Computer Science at N-I-T Trichy. It wasn’t I-I-T Bombay, but the faculty was great, and the campus life was awesome. Looking back, I think it was the right decision. Secured a placement at Amazon with a package of rupee thirty L-P-A, so things worked out in the end.

unnormalised: So, to answer your question directly, don't only fixate on IITB or IITD. Explore all your options. Look at the rankings, course curriculum, placement stats, and campus life. And remember, a good college is just a starting point. Your hard work and skills matter most. All the best to everyone appearing for JEE 2025!
normalised: So, to answer your question directly, don't only fixate on I-I-T-B or I-I-T-D. Explore all your options. Look at the rankings, course curriculum, placement stats, and campus life. And remember, a good college is just a starting point. Your hard work and skills matter most. All the best to everyone appearing for J-E-E two thousand and twenty five!
